thread.title: Hendra: Quarantine after horse dies from Hendra virus on Queensland property | The
thread.title_full: Hendra: Quarantine after horse dies from Hendra virus on Queensland property | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: Hendra: Quarantine after horse dies from Hendra virus on Queensland property | The
text:
Queensland chief veterinary officer Allison Crook said other horses on the Atherton Tablelands property would be monitored for the deadly virus which has infected seven people since it was first discovered in 1994.
Four of the people infected have died, including vets Ben Cunneen and Alister Rodgers.
Dr Crook said vaccinating horses was the best defence against Hendra virus infection.
“Horse owners should discuss their options with their veterinarian,” she said.
“If a horse becomes sick, owners should contact their veterinarian immediately. People in contact with horses need to continue to practice good biosecurity and personal hygiene measures even if a horse is vaccinated against Hendra virus.”
Dr Crook said the latest Hendra virus case was a timely reminder for anybody transporting horses to this year’s Brisbane Ekka, due to start next month.
She said exhibitors were required to demonstrate proof of Hendra virus vaccination.
